item.title: US-China Tech Fight Widens After Taiwan Blacklists Huawei
item.description: Taiwan joined a yearslong US campaign to curtail China’s technological ascent when it blacklisted the country’s AI and chipmaking champions, an unprecedented step that may signal a resurgent effort to isolate its powerful neighbor’s semiconductor sector.
item.dc:creator: Mackenzie Hawkins, Miaojung Lin, Yian Lee

media:content.media:description: A Huawei Technologies Co. store in Shanghai.

item.title: Nintendo Extends Gains to Record on Booming Sales of Switch 2
item.description: Nintendo Co. shares rallied the most in two months to a fresh record as investors increased their focus on the firm’s strong sales growth as a shelter from global volatility.
item.dc:creator: Momoka Yokoyama, Kentaro Tsutsumi

media:content.media:description: Nintendo Switch 2

item.title: AI Startup Anysphere Fields VC Offers at Over $18 Billion Valuation
item.description: Silicon Valley investors are anxious to back the startup they say is the fastest growing of all time.
item.dc:creator: Kate Clark, Katie Roof

media:content.media:description: Michael Truell speaks during a Bloomberg Television interview on June 6.

item.title: Altman Says Meta Offered OpenAI Staffers $100 Million Bonuses
item.description: OpenAI Chief Executive Officer Sam Altman said Meta Platforms Inc. has offered his employees signing bonuses as high as $100 million, with even larger annual compensation packages, as it seeks to build a top artificial intelligence team.
item.dc:creator: Brunella Tipismana Urbano

media:content.media:description: Sam Altman

item.title: How China Is Building a Powerful Army of Hackers
item.description: On today’s Big Take Asia podcast, how China’s domestic hacking competitions are helping boost the country’s cyber-espionage capabilities.
item.dc:creator: K Oanh Ha, Naomi Ng, Yang Yang

item.title: Iran-Israel Conflict Spills to Digital World, Inflaming Rivalry
item.description: The conflict between Israel and Iran is spilling over into the digital world, inflaming a decades-long campaign of hacks and espionage between two nations renowned for their cyber prowess.
item.dc:creator: Patrick Howell O'Neill, Arsalan Shahla

media:content.media:description: A poster bearing the image of Commander-in-Chief of the IRGC Hossein Salami, displayed in front of a Bank Sepah branch in Tehran on June 17, 2025.

item.title: Trump Again Pushes TikTok Sale Deadline With 90-Day Extension
item.description: President Donald Trump is extending for a third time the deadline for Chinese company ByteDance Ltd. to divest the American operations of TikTok, allowing the social media app to keep running in the US while negotiations proceed.
item.dc:creator: Stephanie Lai

media:content.media:description: TikTok Inc. offices in Culver City, California

item.title: KKR, GIC Are Among Final Bidders for MasOrange, Zegona Joint Venture
item.description: KKR & Co. and GIC Pte. are among the final bidders for a stake in a fiber-optic broadband network venture owned by MasOrange and Zegona Communications Plc, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Clara Hernanz Lizarraga, Vinicy Chan, Jillian Deutsch

media:content.media:description: Multi-colored fiber optic cables connected to a terminal.

item.title: Chip Tax Credits Get Boost in Trump Tax Bill | Bloomberg Tech 6/17/2025
item.description: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow discuss how President Trump’s tax bill could boost investment credit for semiconductors to 30%. Plus, the CEO of Applied Intuition talks about how the startup plans to use its latest $600 million fundraising to make more moving machines self-driving. And the CEO of Purism says the company has spoken to the Trump family about supplying its made-in-the-USA smartphones to the new Trump mobile phone service. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Musk’s xAI Burns Through $1 Billion a Month as Costs Pile Up
item.description: Elon Musk’s artificial intelligence startup xAI is burning through $1 billion a month as the cost of building its advanced AI models races ahead of the limited revenues, according to people briefed on the company’s financials.
item.dc:creator: Carmen Arroyo, Jill R Shah

item.title: JPMorgan to Pilot Deposit Token JPMD on Coinbase-Linked Blockchain
item.description: JPMorgan Chase & Co. will launch a pilot for a token called JPMD that represents dollar deposits at the world’s biggest bank, as financial institutions deepen their push into the digital-asset sector.
item.dc:creator: Anna Irrera, Olga Kharif

media:content.media:description: The JP Morgan Chase & Co. headquarters in New York.

item.title: Amazon’s Jassy Says AI Will Reduce Company’s Corporate Ranks
item.description: Amazon.com Inc. Chief Executive Officer Andy Jassy says he expects the company’s workforce to decline in the next few years as the retail and cloud-computing giant uses artificial intelligence to handle more tasks.
item.dc:creator: Matt Day, Spencer Soper

media:content.media:description: Andy Jassy, chief executive officer of Amazon.com Inc., speaks during an unveiling event in New York, US, on Wednesday, Feb. 26, 2025. Amazon has rebooted Alexa with artificial intelligence, marking the biggest overhaul of the voice-activated assistant since its introduction over a decade ago.

item.title: A Lithium Startup Is Building a US Battery Plant That Will Skirt Trump’s Tariffs
item.description: US startup Pure Lithium Corp. is working on a testing facility to build a new type of lithium battery that’s completely manufactured domestically.
item.dc:creator: Elise Harris, Edward Ludlow

media:content.media:description: A brine pool at a Sociedad Quimica y Minera de Chile (SQM) lithium mine on the Atacama salt flat in the Atacama Desert, Chile, on Wednesday, March 13, 2024. After a spectacular bust, battery-metal lithium is showing tentative signs of life on speculation the retracement that convulsed the market last year has forced the conditions for a recovery.

item.title: Musk’s X Sues New York Over Law Requiring Hate-Speech Data
item.description: Elon Musk’s X Corp. sued the state of New York claiming a law requiring social media companies to disclose how they deal with hate speech, extremism and disinformation violates the US Constitution.
item.dc:creator: Bob Van Voris

item.title: Revolut Will Soon Launch Its AI Financial Assistant, UK CEO Says
item.description: Revolut will be launching its AI financial assistant soon, according to one of the fintech’s top executives.
item.dc:creator: Aisha S Gani, Sonia Sirletti

media:content.media:description: Francesca Carlesi in Milan, on June 17. Photographer: Vincenzo Di Cillo /Bloomberg

item.title: Adobe Debuts Standalone App for Generating AI Videos, Images
item.description: Adobe Inc. on Tuesday released a standalone Firefly mobile application for Android and iOS in an attempt to put a larger spotlight on its artificial intelligence-powered image generation and editing tools.
item.dc:creator: Chris Welch

media:content.media:description: Adobe’s Firefly app is available on both iOS and Android.

item.title: Meta Just Bet Big Bucks on AI Talent
item.description: Mark Zuckerberg’s investment in Scale AI and its founder, Alexandr Wang, shows how AI startups have become farm teams for the big-spending giants, explains Bloomberg Opinion columnist Dave Lee. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: SoftBank Sells T-Mobile Stake for $4.8 Billion to Bet on AI
item.description: SoftBank Group Corp. raised around $4.8 billion through a sale of T-Mobile US Inc. shares, a move that helps fund the Japanese company’s grandiose plans for artificial intelligence.
item.dc:creator: Anthony Hughes

media:content.media:description: A T-Mobile store in New York, US, on Monday, Oct. 21, 2024. T-Mobile US Inc. is scheduled to release earnings figures on October 23.

item.title: Musk’s xAI in Talks to Raise $4.3 Billion in Equity Funding
item.description: Elon Musk’s artificial intelligence startup xAI is in talks to raise $4.3 billion through an equity investment on top of the $5 billion it has recently been trying to borrow from debt investors, according to information the company shared with investors who asked not to be identified because it is private.
item.dc:creator: Carmen Arroyo, Jill R Shah

item.title: Salesforce Increases Prices as it Promotes New AI Features
item.description: Salesforce Inc. is increasing the price for many products, becoming the latest software maker to adjust its cost structure as it integrates artificial intelligence.
item.dc:creator: Brody Ford

media:content.media:description: Salesforce Inc. signage on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) in New York, US, on Tuesday, Jan. 21, 2025. A more serene mood settled over markets after a rollercoaster session on Donald Trump's first day in office, with investors looking past the threat of tariffs to the potential boost from fiscal stimulus and tax cuts. Photographer: Michael Nagle/Bloomberg

item.title: 23andMe Fined £2.31 Million by UK Over Genetic Data Leak
item.description: 23andMe was fined £2.31 million ($3.1 million) by UK regulators after a 2023 cyber attack exposed users’ genetic data in yet another privacy crisis surrounding the troubled DNA data bank.
item.dc:creator: Sonja Wind

media:content.media:description: A 23andMe Ancestry + Traits Service DNA kit arranged in Dobbs Ferry, New York, U.S., on on Sunday, Jan. 31, 2021. Consumer DNA-testing company 23andMe Inc. is in talks to go public through a roughly $4 billion deal with VG Acquisition Corp., a special purpose acquisition company founded by billionaire Richard Branson, according to people familiar with the matter. Photographer: Tiffany Hagler-Geard/Bloomberg

item.title: Oracle’s $116 Billion Surge Leaves Little Room for Error on AI
item.description: Oracle Corp. investors find themselves at a pivotal crossroads. Either heed the warning from a growing list of indicators that suggest the stock has run up too far, too fast — or continue to chase another rally that’s been supercharged by lofty artificial intelligence expectations.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Vlastelica

item.title: Applied Intuition Hits $15 Billion Valuation for AI Vehicle Tech
item.description: The company raised $600 million from investors as it prepares for an eventual IPO.
item.dc:creator: Katie Roof

media:content.media:description: Applied Intuition’s automated parking systems.

item.title: Ramp Investors Add Funding as Company Expands, Plans AI Agents
item.description: Spend-management platform Ramp gave existing investors an opportunity to double down on the six-year-old upstart with a recently closed $200 million funding round that boosted the company’s valuation to $16 billion.
item.dc:creator: Emily Mason

media:content.media:description: Eric Glyman, chief executive officer of RAMP, speaks during the Hill & Valley forum at the US Capitol in Washington, DC, US, on Wednesday, April 30, 2025. The Hill and Valley Forum, started in 2023, is a gathering of lawmakers and venture capitalists focused on the US technology industry.

item.title: Tiny Startup Brings Homegrown AI to Mongolia, Avoiding China-US Dominance
item.description: Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Saritha Rai looks at an AI startup in tiny Mongolia and its surprising development of a homegrown large language model.
item.dc:creator: Saritha Rai

media:content.media:description: An artificial intelligence (AI) logo at the MWC25 tech show in Barcelona, Spain, on Tuesday, March 4, 2025. The Mobile World Congress tech show runs March 3-6.

item.title: China’s MiniMax Says Its New AI Reasoning Model Beats DeepSeek
item.description: Chinese AI upstart MiniMax released a new large language model, joining a slew of domestic peers inspired to surpass DeepSeek in the field of reasoning AI.
item.dc:creator: John Liu, Zheping Huang, Jessica Sui

media:content.media:description: AI logo.

item.title: Thiel-Backed Fund Invests in Ex-Citi Banker’s Stablecoin Startup
item.description: A startup run by two-decade Citigroup Inc. veteran Tony McLaughlin raised $10 million from investors including Peter Thiel’s Founders Fund to address an issue it says is holding back adoption of stablecoins.
item.dc:creator: Anna Irrera

media:content.media:description: Peter Thiel Photographer: Marco Bello/Getty Images

item.title: Meta Testing New Auto-Generated Video Ads as Part of AI Push
item.description: Meta Platforms Inc., the owner of Facebook and Instagram, is pushing deeper into AI-generated advertisements in a bid to make it cheaper and simpler for marketers to craft their messages.
item.dc:creator: Kurt Wagner

media:content.media:description: A Meta sign. Photographer David Paul Morris/Bloomberg

item.title: Israel’s Air Shield Is Tested Like Never Before as Iran Fires Ballistic Missiles
item.description: As Iran fires masses of ballistic missiles, Israel’s vaunted air defenses are being tested like never before.
item.dc:creator: Paul Wallace, Galit Altstein

item.title: Trump Tax Bill to Boost Biden’s Chip Tax Credit to 30%
item.description: The Senate’s draft tax bill calls for increasing an investment credit for semiconductor manufacturers, a potential boon for chipmakers that the Trump administration is urging to increase the size of their US projects.
item.dc:creator: Alicia Diaz, Mackenzie Hawkins

media:content.media:description: A bare wafer stacker sorts silicon wafers in Building 51 at Micron Technology Inc. headquarters in Boise, Idaho, US, on Monday, June 10, 2024. The US announced in April its plans to award Micron Technology Inc. $6.1 billion in grants and as much as $7.5 billion in loans to help the memory-chip maker build new American factories, rounding out a slew of major federal awards for advanced semiconductor manufacturing.
